channel.title: Music
channel.description: Anyone know a good place I can download [b]high quality[/b] music? I'm not really into torrenting.

item.title: Music
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

it really depends on what genre of music you want, if you just want ‘popular’ or ‘mainstream’ music, bands or songs then you can find album downloads literally anywhere, torrents (or usenet) usually offer the best quality (in flac or another lossless format, at worse 320kbps), and you can usually find 256kbps at least if you just search google for “album download” and not clicking on scam sites, back in the day there were a few dozen websites for searching rapidshare, megaupload etc for files, if you search the filename you can usually get a valid download link (if it has a password, search for the full filename in google in quotations, with password outside of the quotations)

if on the other hand you find your musical tastes turning up niche styles of music, then searching google for something like [site:blogspot.com album name] without the brackets, you can usually find a blog with a few download links to that album, I’ve found a few dozen rare heavy metal albums on blogspot pages that websites like discgos generally don’t list information for, and where cds, casettes or records generally can’t be found for sale online

Read full topic

item.title: Music
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Youtube is not high quality… it’s all been heavily compressed despite any ‘ripping’ software that you find, you play it through any decent set of speakers and it’ll sound like shit

Read full topic

@Skyro wrote:

Zippyshare, or YouTube Downloader.

item.title: Music
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

http://www.listentoyoutube.com/

That downloads youtube videos in higher quality than many other youtube downloaders. I checked the sound quality between 1 song on a few youtube download sites and the quality of the listentoyoutube one was superior to the rest.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

There are quite a bit of legal issues uploading albums onto a website for other people to download freely, so torrenting is your best option.

item.title: Music
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“Jc22493, post:11, topic:509570”][quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=627815.msg4266363#msg4266363 date=1364087976]
Torrenting is super easy, once you install a program you can pretty much just click a link in a web browser and it will start the torrent, downloading it to wherever you decide.

Not that I would know.


[/quote]

Haha, what program is good?[/quote]
Depends on your OS. If your Windows, I would suggest uTorrent. For Linux, I prefer Transmission.

Read full topic

@jc22493 wrote:

SilentCJ:

If you want full albums in high quality (256kbps and up) then you’re either going to buy it or torrent it, what’s wrong with torrents?

I’ve just never gotten around to it. It seems like too much of a hassle, haha.

Anyone know a good place I can download high quality music? I’m not really into torrenting.
[/quote]grooveshark.com is a good place to listen to music, not sure about downloading though without torrenting[/quote]
Thanks. I usually use Spotify though haha.

Lin:

Groovedown and mp3juices.com

Are those good sources? Meaning full HQ albums, etc. I’ll check them out later.

[quote=“drubrkletern, post:5, topic:509570”]try downloading hd videos from youtube o.O
then convert to like mp3 etc if you want[/quote]
That takes way too long if I’m looking to download whole albums haha.
